Reviews.Title: “Magnificent in every way”
Reviews.Author: sputnikdomino
Reviews.Content: The staff was incredibly professional. The food is excellent. We held our wedding at this venue and could not have asked for anything more. The only downside is that it isn't easy to find, and taxis to and from the city centre can add up, however if you're willing to stay on site and enjoy their spa, pool, and restaurant, then it's a perfect break. The castle is tastefully decorated and the antique furniture stunning. The Castellucia is magic!

Reviews.Title: “wonderfully restored castle”
Reviews.Author: jictor
Reviews.Content: the castle was simply the loveliest place we've ever stayed at. it was great not so much in terms of luxury or facilities, but in terms of its beauty and sense of history. every little corner was a lovely surprise - whoever restored the castle and decorated it did a marvellous job. unfortunately we have to discount our rating by a star for its appalling breakfast and inconsistent service, but for only 100euros a night for the small room we were really stoked that we got to stay at such a wonderful place that turned out to be the highlight of our visit to Rome. I'd highly recommend it unless you have a very short visit to rome and can't spare the time travelling to get to the sights, or have a lot of luggage to carry around by public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Simply beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Brenda_HutchinsonKS
Reviews.Content: We loved it! The staff was super friendly and top notch. We had to take a taxi from the train station due to a mis-communication regarding which Guistiana station to arrive at. (There are 2 stations with the same name!) The swimming pool was incredibly beautiful! The scenery was as well, it was just so peaceful. We wish we had had more time to spend at this place! We ate dinner in the hotel restaurant and was very impressed-Salvadore is a fabulous server. Our rooms were immaculate and just dreamy.... If you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city then this is the place to go. We absolutely loved our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of its rating”
Reviews.Author: golfer031
Reviews.Content: The good reviews given this hotel by other travellers were not in evidence in a recent stay at this hotel on the outskirts of Rome. While very difficult to locate, the property is located in beautiful surroundings. However, the lack of attention to detail makes this hotel, at best, a 2 or 3 star property. For instance: 1. Our room's (room 214) air conditioning vent was obscured by the curtain for the window. Since the room overlooked the front entrance to the hotel, we had the choice of leaving the curtain open so as to cool the room (with the result of having the outside lights stream into the room), or closing the curtain and thereby cutting off the cool air flow (resulting in a very warm room). 2. The "period" pieces in the room (the dresser, minibar, etc.) were not well maintained. The doors to these items would not shut flush, and the handle to one of the doors actually fell off during our stay. 3. The lighting in the room was extremely poor, making the room quite dark. 4. The bathroom was tiny, and not representative of a top flight hotel. All in all, this hotel did not justify the high ratings given it by other reviewers, at least during our brief stay. We will search for another hotel in the area if needed in a subsequent trip.

Reviews.Title: “Castello della Castelluccia”
Reviews.Author: irun_11
Reviews.Content: Castello della Castelluccia is located near Rome, and surrounded by a park of more than 500 hectares. Several years ago the castle had been restored and visitors can marvel at its grandeur and beauty. Castle takes visitors all year round. The castle is now Castelluccia hotel with comfortable rooms, furnished with antique furniture. In the tower of the castle-hotel are suites. In the Locanda you can taste dishes from the old menu and bask in the huge fireplace. At the garden - a wellness center with swimming pool. The hotel can accommodate Kastelyuchcha with their small pets. Castello della Castelluccia was built in the 11th century by the family Castelluccia in place of the imperial villas of Roman times. For 8 centuries of its existence it was the castle home to many aristocratic families, including Orsini, Muti, Odelskani and tenor Marconi. In the wellness center features a Turkish bath, sauna, large swimming pool, solarium and jacuzzi. Customers can also play tennis, golf, horse riding or visit the gym. For those who want guided tours in the surroundings of Rome and places associated with the Etruscans. Hotel Castello della Castelluccia has a comfortable conference room for up to 200 guests for meetings, conferences and presentations. Castle-Hotel Castelluccia is perfect place for a wedding - romantic Italian style garden, perfect location and a chapel and a tower you can see magnificent views of the surrounding area. The hotel has 23 rooms, which are named for the famous people who lived in the castle. The rooms antique furniture ages 15-19, which is perfectly combined with modern technology. 4 rooms and 2 rooms DBL Suite have access to the garden. Hotel Bathrooms are marble. Dark wooden furniture and the whole situation: amphorae, blue-gray sofas, busts, candelabra tourist immersed in the Middle Ages. The dining room in rustic style of the Middle Ages with a vaulted ceiling, brick walls, fireplace, and lights, simulating torches now open to visitors. You can dine in the restaurant with yellow walls, twined with garlands and a simple wooden floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very romantic castello, excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mirko C
Reviews.Content: We (my wife and I) stayed 5 days/6 nights in early August after a cruise on the Mediterrainain Sea. We arrived with a rental car and had no plans to visit Rome, which we did on another trip. We wanted to visit the countryside little villages in Umbrie and Toscane. Front office manager Luca turned out to be an excellent trip advisor, he had all kind of very good ideas about places and restaurants to visit, which we did. He even helped us out solving a problem we had with the local Hertz store in Civitavecchia. The staff appeared to be very freindly and helpfull, a special thank you to the pool attendant, excellent service! The pool is really enjoyable, very clean, quiet and relaxed. The only thing is that you have to conquer some steps to go down and back up to the hotel. We booked two nights in the reataurant because after the first night we were very pleased with the service, food and wine (very good local wine, not very expensive), so we decided to book again. We didnt regret that. Out room (105) was spacious, very clean and quiet. Even when there was a wedding with music outside, we could fall asleep without being bothered by loud noise because there was none. The staf obviously knows how to manage the weddings. Absolutely a place to recommend and tp visit again during our future trips to Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice fascility but really bad service and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Ulrika K
Reviews.Content: Really on the countryside with nice rooms and pool area. The staff and restaurant really needs development. Service was poor with attitude. Not possible to get for example a sandwich after lunch hours and in the evening. The bar was closed (open on the paper) so no possibitliy to sit outside and have a drink in the nice warm evenings. Due to this wish we were closer to other places to eat and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful castle....quiet location.....but that is where it ends!”
Reviews.Author: Neenee1976
Reviews.Content: We were touring italy and one of our highlights was Rome.....before I arrived, I asked for a bottle of wine to be put in the room for my honeymoon. To my horror, without even being asked.....they had put a 50 pound bottle of wine in the room, my wife was worth it but I wasn't consulted. They ran a shuttle bus to the train station because it was a 10 minute drive, they offered no train map our advice as to which stop to use, they only offered the shuttle until 10.30 and when the train got us in 15 minutes late they had no one to come and get us and we had to flag a taxi down, which wasn't easy as it seemed to be the only one! The room was superb and the castle was beautiful but we had a meal in the restaurant as there is no other choice because of location.....the portions wouldnt have filled up my children, let alone me. It was very poor and cost us nearly 100 euros. Overall this hotel promises a lot but delivers little, I think I would have spent better money on a hotel nearer to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: BENSONYork_England
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms at this hotel on the last night on our way home from our Umbrian Italy trip chiefly because it was near to the airport for the following morning. We didn't check to much re the detail due to this but what a surprise. A real classy gem of a hotel. Lovely decor. Quality clean rooms. Friendly and efficient staff. A huge swimming pool with on site attendant to issue a towel and show you to you recliner. Quality food with formal polite staff. Not that cheap a restaurant but you felt you were getting value for money due to the quality. Despite a 'one night stop', this spot was one of our hotel highlights and would certainly recommend it. Not that easy to find off the bustle of the nearby dual carriageway, and pool some way down from the main hotel, but minor points as this is a lovely quality spot.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Castle”
Reviews.Author: Demetrio-T
Reviews.Content: Castelluccia Castle is like a fairy tale casle, located in a residential area, 20 minutes away from the center of Rome (with Metropolitano train). The castle has a magical and romantic atmosphere, and is the perfect place for romance, honeymoon or a perfect wedding. Everything is from the tenth century, food is delicious,the SPA and masagges are magnificent. They also have a semi olimpic outdoor pool with bar. You can enjoy walking in gardens and next by forest, or landscapes from tower suite where they can serve you dinner also! In the morning on the second floor terrace you can have a delicious capuccino and admiring Rome. The staf is very friendly and will provide you with a lot of informations and plan short trips or limusine to the airport. The hotell offers us a welcome drink and a Ferrari bottle & fruits in our Junior suite. If you didn't rent any car, you can ask for the hotel free shuttle to tha Giustiniana metropolitan station to go in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value”
Reviews.Author: CelicaFredericton
Reviews.Content: Room was a good price, however everything else was price too high - if you plan on eating at the restaurant - take advantage of their meal plan, you'll be surprised how much it will save you (especially if you plan on 3 courses) . I gatta say though the place is pretty cool. It was empty when we were there. Service is nothing to complain about. 25 min by train to the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Loads of Character”
Reviews.Author: SusanALopez
Reviews.Content: We were on a road trip though Italy with 4 other couples. One of the couples booked this hotel. I've stayed in central Rome on several occasions and we were just staying one night so this seemed like a great option. I've also stayed in restored castles before and have to say this one was beautifully restored and full of charm, character and modern conveniences. Our deluxe room (general description for what we term a standard) was large and well furnished. It was lovely and very well maintained-unlike some other '';classic' hotels I've stayed at in Italy. Everyone had a different style room on a differnt level owing to the restrictions of the ancient architecture. We arrived late from our travels and dinner was waiting or us. As it was March there were few other guests. The food served by the restaurant was excellent and they even had a cake ordered by my friends for my birthday. The service was satisfactory and they were cordial even when we kept them up late in the small bar as we unwound from our drive. TIP: If you know Rome then you would be aware that staying outside makes it difficult to get into town and parking is also a nightmare. I don't recommend staying outside (and then compaining) if you plan on going into the city everyday as this is not realistic. I do recommend this hotel if you are driving and will be traveling on after one day or so. It is something unique and very quiet and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: JUneUSA
Reviews.Content: Staff is snotty and unfriendly. They actually seem miserable to be there. There was a wedding when we arrived so it was quite confusing. The food was excellent though. The staff needs some hospitality training. Out of 2 weeks of hotels this was by far the most unfriendly! Room service says to put out card before 2am. We placed the card out and never received any breakfast at our room. Service would be a rating of "0" in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “The rave reviews just didn't ring true.”
Reviews.Author: taesung
Reviews.Content: It's a few months since our visit to Castello della Castelluccia but I felt as I rely so heavily upon Tripadvisor reviews when booking holidays, it wasn't fair to not write this. My partner and I were so excited about our 5-day trip having read all the great reviews and seen all the beautiful photos but when we arrived, we felt like we'd been duped. The rooms were not nearly as lavish as the pictures had suggested, the facilities were largely out of use for our stay, e.g. the swimming pool and the cafe area upstairs, despite it being really hot. The gym was also very small and smelly and the breakfasts were rubbish, really rubbish. There was very little selection and the quality of the food was terrible and we had Abba playing every morning! When wandering around the grounds, everything seemed to be in a state of disarray and we got the distinct impression that this is just not the place to go off season or before the end of May. There was an organised party in the hotel on one night and only then did the staff seem to make an effort. Overall, we felt this place had enormous potential but fell well short on what it had promised to deliver. The decor was awful and cheap and tacky looking and there were nasty, dusty fake flowers everywhere. It would have made such a difference if these had been real but no real effort was made anywhere. The only real plus point which was also a negative was the fact that the hotel is in the middle of nowhere and it is a very long walk to the nearest train station in the local town (which seemed very sweet) so although it was nice not to be staying in the centre of Rome, it was a mission to get into town (an hour to an hour and a half's journey) and as we were there over Easter, this was more difficult than usual. It was also very expensive to get back to the hotel from the city centre with taxis costing around £25. So it was either this or get the last train and shuttle back to the hotel around 10pm. We did love Rome and would love to return, but next time we'll be staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel outside of Rome”
Reviews.Author: mbsteal2002
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from our 2 week trip to Europe. Rome was our first stop and loved this hotel the best! The castle was amazing and the staff went out of their way to help us whenever we needed it. I hadn't used the train systems before and once I figured it out it was very easy to get from the shuttle on the trains to downtown Rome. You just needed to have an idea on when the trains ran. that's typical anywhere in europe and we didn't need to use a taxi once. we used RomaCabs to get there and bought the Roma Passes which made the train travel a snap. The food was wonderful - I didn't see it anymore expensive than anywhere else we ate. Pool was great - my daughter loved it. I would say that on the weekends - yes they do have a lot of weddings - beautiful place for it but they acknowledged it and let us know so we wouldn't be inconvienced. We will definitely stay here if we go back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel in the Outskirts of Rome”
Reviews.Author: finsth
Reviews.Content: It was our last night in Italy after a glorious 5 weeks spent mostly in Tuscany. We were looking for a special hotel within an hour of Fiumicino Airport. Castello della Castelluccia fit the bill. It was recommended by the Michelin Red Guide which gave it 3 rouge maisons. Just the type of Michelin rating we love to stay in. Yet we had been disappointed by a similar rating for a hotel outside Orvieto where we stayed the night before. This place however lived up to its rating. A beautifully restored castle full of charm, character and modern conveniences. It was also very professionally run. Our standard room (deluxe they called it) was large and looked very medieval except for the flush toilet and other modern conveniences. It was lovely. The food served by the restaurant was delicious. We had the shrimp ravioli and vegetable and lamb pasta both of which were very tasty particularly the ravioli. Our veal main courses were also delicious. We enjoyed the lovely pool (it is a bit of a hike to get there). All in all a wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicolaD60
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in the Irish College in central Rome in March 2009. We wanted to stay in a hotel that would match the grandeur of the wedding, and the Castello della Castelluccia was no diasappointment! 13 of us in the wedding party stayed in beautifully furnished bedrooms (as the married couple we were upgraded to a suite with a fireplace and jacquzzi bath at no extra cost by the management). The details of the hotel were more akin to a 5 star hotel in the UK, complete with bath robes and slippers in each bathroom. The decor was just fabulous, as our family slept in rooms with four poster beds and frescos. We ate a delicious meal on the evening of our wedding, and the chefs were happy to cater for our veggie family members. The surrounding lawns, orange trees and castle interior are perfect for photographs. The only inconvenience was the location outside central Rome, but the hotel is very close to the Metro which connects in 20-30 minutes to Metro line A, which is perfect for the sightseeing stops of St Peters, Spanish Steps, Trevi fountain etc. There is a courtesy bus that brings you from the metro back to the hotel 6 times a day, times were a bit inconvenient but as we were a large party we just agreed in advance when to arrive back in the evening. The suburban location also made it fantastic value - I imagine we would have paid excessive amounts of money to stay in a similar hotel in the centre of rome. The spa, with turkish baths and a sauna included in the price of the accommodation, was also a fantastic way to chill out before and after the big day, during times when members of the wedding party could not face sightseeing trips! Also, the breakfast was to die for, with a good choice of bacon and scrambled eggs, bread, cheese, eggs, pastries, coffee, juice etc). If I had to do it all again, I would definately choose the Castello as the place to spend our first few days as a married couple abroad. The hotel is designed as a fantastic wedding, honeymoon or romantic location, but is not neccessarily the best place to stay if you are just sightseeing Rome. I will dearly miss the place!

Reviews.Title: “Loved castello della castelluccia”
Reviews.Author: MMM_Toronto
Reviews.Content: The hotel I was supposed to stay at during one night of my tour was actually overbooked, so 5 of us were put up in rooms at Castello della castelluccia. We checked in at around 10:45 p.m. and my room (more like a suite) was huge! The room was so beautiful, and the bathroom...that was the size of some of the hotel rooms I had during the tour. I had the best night's sleep on the tour at this hotel. It was so comfortable and clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel for couples. The only downside, it did seem far from the other hotel that our tour stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon heaven, Tourist Hell”
Reviews.Author: catman_willy
Reviews.Content: As part of a planned trip to Italy this hotel was booked on the basis of its price and TA ranking. We like our creature comforts and very rarely stay below 3 stars so when we saw that three nights at the Castello would be les than three hundred pounds and was four stars as well we booked straight away in Nov 07. We booked through Lastminute.com and selected a deluxe double with spa and continental breakfast. When we set off on a driving tour of Italy some 10 months later I took into account recent reviews that mentioned the hotel being hard to find. I printed off the Google arial photo of the hotel and surrounding roads as well as programming it into my sat nav. We arrived in Rome around 2pm via the A1 motor way and the city ring road. As the sat nav counted down to less than two miles to go we spotted the first of many signs to the hotel and followed it - straight into a dead end. A housing estate had been built since the photo used by google had been taken or the software for my satnav had been written. Several false trys led nowhere but dead ends. We therefore ignored the satnav and tried another of the roads on the map. Again as we got near there were more signs but this time the road ended in a quarry. A third attempt coming in from the north along Via Cassia finally got us to the hotel, after an hour of driving around and around. Sorry to go on but this set the scene for the rest of the stay. The former castle is certainly an impressive sight but from the outside has no signage at all to indicate where the front door is or directions to reception. Only a delivery taking place gave away that the heavy iron gates in the front of the building are the main door. The reception staff were typically Italian in their aloof manner and made us feel that I was an inconvenience to their work. The member of staff dealing with us even ignored us for a moment to sign the delivery mans papers despite three other members of staff standing around. When we got to our room it was stiflingly hot. The A/C had not been switched on. Further more our prebooked spa bath was a bog standard one under the window with a shower over it. I went straight back to reception to query this. I was told in a very matter of fact way that Lastminute.com had incorrectly listed the room facilities and that the hotel had informed them of this numerous times. The mention of a spa was in fact free access to the hotel spa facilities - swimming pool - and not a jacuzzi bath as the blurb suggested. To compound things it later became evident that the location of the bath against the window prevented a curtain being hung there. Therefore if you needed to have a shower after dark you had to do so with the light off for fear of people outside seeing you in the bath room. There are rooms available with jacuzzi baths but only those costing a great deal more per night. The rest of the room was clean but otherwise like many business hotels. there is a mini bar, barely effective A/C unit and a safe but no iron or trouser press and no coffee making facilities. Our room,211, overlooked the terrace used by restaurant guests and so included their chatter and noise. The large swimming pool to the rear of the hotel was down eleven flights of precariously steep stairs. On the first night we went into Rome on the train returning around 8.30pm to take dinner in the restaurant. we were advised that we should have booked in advance, despite being a guest there and there being no other places to eat within three miles! When we were eventually seated it was in amongst a large Italian family gathering celebrating a 25th wedding anniversary. The starter of Gnocchi was plentiful but of one flavour throughout the dish. My wifes seafood ravioli starter was again plentiful and she was impressed by the many tastes it gave her. For our mains we both had veal dishes with roasted eggplant and mozzarella. Thats exactly what we got. A fatty piece of meat, two pieces of roasted aubergine topped with grated mozzarella and a piece of stuffing. the portion size was small and swimming in grease. We asked for a bottle of house red to go with it and were served a bottle of chianti called "Oddone". Breakfast the following morning was little better. Scrambled eggs and bacon were the only hot options. the rest being apple croissants - no plain ones or pan chocolate, There was choice of cold meats that you had to slice yourselves along with cheese in a similar manner. This was all taken whilst lift music was played into the room. The second night we took dinner in Rome but returned to find another wedding reception on and the only parking place available at the bottom of the very steep hill to the rear of the hotel. Nine flights of steep steps back to our room were not what we wanted after a long day on the tourist trail. Day three was much the same but this time it was scrambled eggs and sausage. On the evening another wedding that went on until 1am with noisey vocal guests and fireworks outside our window. On the face of it this impressve looking four star establishment is ideal for those that want silver service meals by waiters in white tunics or if you want a fairytale wedding location. If like me you want four star accomodation for a base from which to explore Rome then look elsewhere. It is 90 minutes and two trains to the Rome Termini station, impossible to find and treats non italian guests in a less favourable fashion.

Reviews.Title: “HONEYMOON ONLY!!!”
Reviews.Author: NanaChicago8
Reviews.Content: Okay, I'll start with the negatives. The food is horrible and expensive. Save your money and appetite for Rome. The food in Rome is awesome. Transportation is horrible. If you call a cab they start charging from the moment they get the request in. So wherever they are at (Rome, around the area, or wherever), by the time the cab gets to you for pick up, you're already paying between 15 to 20 euros not including your ride into Rome. The shuttle bus only runs upon request. On our final days in the castle we got stranded at the station. The excuse was that they had car problems. Note they have a farely new Mercedes Benz Van as there shuttle that runs in perfect condition. My opinion, they forgot to pick us up and lied about it. We had to walk all the way to the castel and what we got was a bottle of wine. I guess something is better than nothing. Now for the possitives. The castle is beautiful. the room we stayed in was the one in the picture that its shown with the canopy bed - very beautiful. We got very lucky and the two weeks that we stood there 8/11/08 - 08/22/08 happen to be an italian holiday, which means that there were no weddings or hardy anyone there. The stores and most businesses where all shut down and closed. Because we were in our honeymoon, having the hotel and pool pretty much to ourselves was Perfect! The view of the landscaping was gorgious! 100% romantic. It was very nice to leave the busy streets of Rome into a beautiful, quite, romantic setting! Overall, we did know about the food and transportation problem and we did mentally prepare for it. What we did just planned our day occordingly and mastered the train system. Train system is very easy and the front desk did do a good job at explaining it. This place is not for family or friends vacation. Strickly for honeymoon or a quick getaway to unwind because there is nothing to do in that area and your far from Rome. They do have info on horse back riding and golfing but thats either a little out of the way or the horse back riding that talk about in the website is not offered by them but by a local farmer. Would we stay here again, yes. Only because if we were looking for a romantic setting, this is perfect. The hotels in Rome are not that pretty and don't offer a swimming pool. With this hotel you have ask yourself what exactly are you looking for. If quite and romantic is what your looking for, this is it. If not, RUN. Your better off staying at a local (nice) hotel in the center of Rome where everything for the most part is walking distance and food is great. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome but a few minor inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: adamsfam18
Reviews.Content: There are so many great things to say about this castle hotel. First of all, it's a castle and it is in great shape. We requested rooms with views of the mountains which was beautiful. The food was great but yes a tad expensive. The hotel had so many unique characteristics and was fun to explore. The shuttle says it's at fixed times but we found out you have to let them know when to pick you up at the station or they don't come. You must check the time tables at the stations in the city to see when the trains come because they are not as often as you would like. The whole transportation system in rome is slow in general so plan on a lot of extra travel time. Overall I thought it was worth it and wish i could get married in this magical place. The staff was very helpful. Would recommend not staying on a weekend if you want to avoid weddings because there was one when we were there and they got quite noisy late at night. The best hotel we stayed at while in Italy

Reviews.Title: “Car essential, and for experienced Rome visitors only”
Reviews.Author: Gordon2112
Reviews.Content: On the whole we enjoyed out weekend stay at the Castello. I have visited Rome many times on business and have usually stayed in a city centre hotel. As this trip was mainly holiday, I deliberately chose the Castello as I wanted a relaxing break away from the noise and crowds in the centre. The idea of a castle also appealed and the hotel website had some very attractive pictures of the place. The drive in our hire car from Fiumicino airport to the hotel should have taken less than 30 minutes, but even though I had programmed the hotel address carefully into the memory, we were still not adequately prepared for he chaotic (i.e. typically Roman) road network approaching the hotel. The first thing to note is that the hotel can only be approached from the North, any maps showing direct vehicle access from the southeast of La Giustiniana village are wrong, you will just end up back on the GRA!!! After two phone calls to the hotel and lots of driving around in the dark, we eventaully found the hotel access road. Driving hints: continue driving northwest of La Giustiniana on Via Cassia for approx 1.5km. DO NOT be tempted to turn off Via Cassia into La Giustiniana centre. If you are sharp-eyed you will then see a small yellow hotel sign indicating a left turn off Via Cassia. So, turn left, go straight ahead at the small roundabout and under the railway bridge. Then turn left at the T-junction and follow what can best be described as a pot-holed farm track (!) for approx 1.5km, turning towards the left at a small restaurant, then climbing slightly uphill. The hotel is at the end of the final 300m straight section. The hour wasted trying to find the hotel in the dark with inadequate directions from the hotel was stressful, completely avoidable if the hotel were to add the above information to their website (and put up a bigger sign), and did not get the trip off to a good start. Check-in was fine, and the Castello does look very impressive floodlit at night. We were allocated a small "attic" room with exposed beams. Not a particularly bad room, but were were expecting something with a "wow" factor after seeing the pictures on the website. We were also dissatisfied with having a skylight as the only window and a very small bathroom. I raised these issues with the front desk the following morning and we were transferred to a more pleasant room with a great view out of the window and a larger bathroom with bath. We ate two dinners in the hotel, the first was excellent and reasonably priced for the quality of food and the atmospheric dining room. The second meal was definitely inferior - one of our orders came out wrong and my tuna steak was overcooked. Pity, as a hotel in this price bracket with such an atmospheric dining room really needs to deliver the highest food standards. Our other dinner was taken at the Antica restaurant round the corner from the railway station in La Giustiniana, a typical local restaurant with pleasant Italian staples and cosy atmosphere. I was glad to have the car though as it was raining. Some other reviewers have mentiomed walking from the hotel to La Giustiniana but I would not advise this at all unless you are a fit, determined walker and have plenty of time on your hands. A hire car is virtually essential for the Castello. I also noticed that there was no taxi rank visible in the villagem and it would be unwise to rely on the hotel shuttle which is very infrequent and can be late if the rush hour traffic is bad (happened to us the one time we used this service). On balance we enjoyed our short stay at this hotel, but I would rate it more highly had it not been for the accessibility problems oin the first night and the patchy service in the restaurant. Both these issues could easily be tackled by the hotel management if they chose to do so. So, recommended but watch out for the issues mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but lacking elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller34
Reviews.Content: After seeing the website and reading other traveller reviews my expectations were high for this hotel, and although aesthetically it was as beautiful as advertised, I encountered several small disappointments which lowered my overall opinion of the hotel. On arrival, the staff were very friendly. The room we were allocated was not as grand as those shown on the website, but considering we had booked through last minute we had expected to be given a small room so this was not an issue. Whilst some staff were happy to help with enquiries we came across two or three individuals who were downright rude. As mentioned by some other guests (both in reviews and whilst actually at the hotel) there is a major problem with the transport to and from the local train station. Although this is only about 2 km away, there is no recognised footpath (although we did manage to find our way on foot one morning after missing the bus) and the staff were unaccommodating if when we found ourselves stuck at the station one night after missing the last bus back to the hotel. The castle is beautiful and very remote, but I would imagine that if you are going to the area you are planning to visit Rome and as such I would recommend you stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Give this one a miss, folks!”
Reviews.Author: CapTeb
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Castello as part of our honeymoon in the Rome area hoping to have a nice quiet relaxing break and have to say that as far as being a Hotel our experience was far less than what we expected. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were treated as an inconvenience. We enquired prior to arriving in Rome about transport to and from the Hotel and had been informed that a taxi fare from the main railway station in Rome to the Castello would be approx 20 Euros it actually came to 49 Euros which would reduce depending upon the day, time of travel, number of passengers and baggage. In spite of contacting the castello prior to our arrival concerning travel arrangements, we were only informed upon arrival that the pool and leisure facilities were under renovation and as such not available for us to use. Also because the castello had been booked for a wedding party the main restaurant was not available and that dinner would be served in another part of the castle, in a deserted function hall where we had to then go in search of a member of staff. Throughout the duration of our stay various areas of the castle were 'off limits' due to other events having been booked and we found that we only had free access to the roof terrace. As a consequence of several events taking place during our stay the staff were always too busy with other concerns to help and at times outride rude. Unless you are booking this place for your own event we would strongly recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “For weddings maybe ... for tourists ?? Hmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: Prokop62
Reviews.Content: Sorry fellow travelers - but this one seems to have lost direction... - The issues: Pool not open (29 Coutside..) - No lounge chairs in garden at all to sit and relax ... Gourmet restaurant closed 2 nights out of three for weddings (mind you there was alternative seating in another room ) Spa area closed Our room was below ground - No daylight (220Euro/night booked as deluxe room...) - No minibar ... Satelite Tv - Yes .. but CNN & Italian Channels only ... Food in Restuarant very mediocre & expensive (we aussumed that due to large wedding taking place chefs were preocupied...) Staff helpfull - most of the time .. - the Suttle Bus runs on fixed hours to the Station only (we assumed it would go further on - in their brocheure it says so...) but can be convinced to be more flexible with some Euros extra... We knew it was not near the centre - but understimated travel dtime to sights using Public transport - so about 1 1/2 hours net to St.Peter .... So in essence actually why go there ?? - Location is nice yes ... but what else ? -

Reviews.Title: “Our Fantastic Wedding in an Incredible Place”
Reviews.Author: agrasso
Reviews.Content: This review has been a long time coming. We got married at Castelluccia in 2004. We stumbled upon the perfect place to get married outside of Rome. It is a gem of a hotel. The perfect little 5 star castle. I couldn't believe the place when we first saw it. My family is from Rome and I happened to come across it on the Internet. Rooms: they are lovely. We stayed or have seen most rooms. Wonderful. Some with huge bathtubs. Food: The restaurant serves top class food. The food at our dinner was amazing. I'm still thinking about it and our guests mention it all the time. Service: this is a 5 star and they will do everything to make your stay wonderful. You will not be disappointed in Castelluccia whatever the event is. We even stayed at their sister hotel in Rome, the Empire, and that place was wonderful as well. I will forever be grateful to the staff at Castelluccia for making our wedding the most special of weddings. We have been back a couple of times since and it's always wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: losven
Reviews.Content: Don't get put off by the village La Giustiniana or the way up to the hotel. Things do improve as you draw closer. A word of warning is that the hotel's shuttle bus only runs on a fixed schedule every 2 hours. As the hotel is rather isolated a more bespoke service would be valuable. Arriving at the hotel we noticed that it looked just like in the piuctures. Our room was very nice and surprised us by containing a built in tiled whirlpool with room for at least 4 people. It took 45 minutes to fill up but it sure was a relaxing experience. Service was great both in the reception, the bar and the restaurant. However, the restaurant is really the only dent in the protocol. It's prices match an upscale gourmet restaurant in central Rome. The food is OK but not great, just expensive. The same goes for the wines. If you find ways to get to other restaurants in the area that may be a better idea. Also the menu is exactly the same for lunch and dinner so a longer visit may end up quite boring. Anyway, we truly enjoyed our stay. It is a perfect way to start or end your Roman holiday. Or maybe take a break from the high pulse in the capital.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: patjennings45
Reviews.Content: This may be the best hotel that I have ever stayed in! It is at the top of the 4* category but the price is so reasonable as to make you wonder why! The customer service is outstanding and the castle itself is beautiful. The rooms are all lovely with period features and furnishings and they have the full works of beauty clinic, bar, swimming pool and high quality restaurant featuring superb breakfast daily (we ate dinner in it twice, one of which was a gourmet five course meal with wine for 35 euros per head – bargain – the other was a fair bit more…). The views over the Roman countryside are wonderful; the hotel is down a sort of millionaire’s avenue which has a lovely little family run trattoria at the other end. The train station into Rome is about 5 minutes drive, but there is a regular free shuttle bus. All day tickets are cheap – around 1 euro fifty, as I recall. Rome itself is, of course, wonderful, and this place just made it all the more magical. So much so that we got engaged there!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Comfort”
Reviews.Author: ohtoofun2007
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a real castle a few km outside of Rome (15 minute drive from Centro) that was originally built close to 2000 years ago. It is on countless acres of land and has a huge, elegant pool. It was a welcome, quiet, elegant respite from the chaos and crowds in Rome. Landscaping is top notch with rolling hills surrounding - our favourite hotel in Italy. Our room was upgraded without asking to a junior suite - what a great welcome after a long drive. We had scenic views from two sides of the room and also had a terrace we could sit on. Upon arrival, the front desk staff for evenings spoke excellent english and italian. She was very amiable and efficient, providing all the information we needed to know of the hotel. She recommended the hotel restaurant - a great experience - extremely knowledgeable and professional staff - food was perfect and far less expensive than I would have expected. Champagne and then a small appetizer was presented without charge. The room is so warm, large and comfortable that I hardly wanted to leave it to visit Rome. It contained elegant antique furniture and a large bathroom with an extremely comfortable tub and elegant fittings - lots of marble. The other room in our suite had a television as did our bedroom. I was travelling with a child who was treated with much respect and warmth from all staff - she loved this hotel too (she found it on the internet herself). The price of this hotel is extremely reasonable for what it provides - it is worth far more - a tremendous value.

Reviews.Title: “Fairytale setting.”
Reviews.Author: TracyandJoeRushton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June, and loved it! Our room was small, and in a turret with no view, but the castle and grounds are beautiful. It's a bit of a trek to the pool, which wasn't very clean, and the loungers need updating. Food and drink is expensive there, but of very good quality, and the service was superb. Luca and his team on reception were extremely helpful. Travelling into Rome isn't difficult, the transport system in Italy is excellent, but it was difficult to make sure you were back at the station on time to catch the shuttle bus back to the hotel. Sat on the balcony, sipping cold chardonnay, it was hard to believe that we were so close to Rome. After a day of sightseeing it was lovely to return to the peace and quiet of the castle. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of our Trip”
Reviews.Author: kenjusa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of our 2 week honeymoon, and it was the best hotel and restaurant of the bunch. The room was twice the size of typical rooms in the 200-300 Euro price range, nice four poster bed, gorgeous 25m pool, pretty grounds. Travel into downtown Rome is easy. Staff was wonderful, the bartender gave us some advice on nearby sights, and was nice enough to get the kitchen to make us some late-night sandwiches after a long drive down from Florence, after missing dinner. The highlight, and the best evening of our honeymoon, was a fantastic 8 course meal put on by the hotel on our last night, with a cocktail reception, after dinner drinks, and several wines. The dinner lasted 4 hours, and the food was amazing. We will most certainly book a return for one of our anniversaries.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good”
Reviews.Author: MaLo
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of the comments posted previously. The hotel is very nice, the pool is great but the loungers are not. The pool assistant was very good. The food in the hotel was quite good. Breakfast was decent. In the main we ate out in Rome or Giustiniana. We ate at the hotel once in the evening and asked for a tasting menu. The regular menu was quite short, but did seem quite well composed and I would have happily eaten from it had our request not been possible. The chef prepared a broad selection of dishes, mostly not from the menu and selected wine to compliment his creations. The food offered was very good and for the quality and quantity very good value. The room was comfortable everything worked as expected. There were times, however, when an extra pair of hands would have made a big difference. The same staff seemsed to work from dawn till dusk and the bar closed very early most nights. Taxis. The most irritating aspect was the taxis. It is very difficult to stay at this hotel and not spend a considrable sum on taxis. It was cheaper to get a taxi form central rome (E18 - 26) than it was from the local station a couple of kilometeres away, the most expensive costing E28. The restaurant (Ristorante Giustiniana) across the road and to the right from the train station was good and also worth a visit. Just dont ring a taxi!! The hotel could really improve by adding a few more staff for general customer service / bar etc and increasing the frequency / extending the operating time of the shuttle bus. Some minor niggles but mostly good and I would return happily.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful with a flaw”
Reviews.Author: rioruss
Reviews.Content: This is a stunning building fantastically maintained in an idyllic location. It is certainly the quietest place we have ever stayed at. The hotel was full but we never heard a sound. No cars, no aircraft, nothing Clean with great attention to detail and a fantastic countryside pool. But the food. Strictly limited Menu (choice of 3 starters, 3 mains and 3 ice creams for dessert) and that is the evening a la carte. And regretfully even those three courses are fairly inedible. Nearest other restaurant is over a mile away so you are fairly trapped. So go there for the beauty and solitude but definitely eat out. (And yes, those sun bed sare a tad hard.)

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous setting some issues though”
Reviews.Author: hobbesmanc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is several miles from the Rome ring road and about 30 mins drive from Fiumicino Airport. It is a beautifully restored building oozing charm and character with friendly and professional staff. We were in July and the room rate was really reasonable for the standard of accomodation. The room had a lovely view and was stylishly furnished with a grand marble bathroom. When we booked the room , the hotel informed us that there was a wedding on and therefore the dining room was not available. However we were informed that we would be able to eat in a gazebo in the grounds. Unfortunately this was not the intimate corner in the garden that we anticipated but a large marquee. The venue is obviously very popular with wedding parties and to be honest as none guests we felt a bit excluded. The bar and terrace areas were not accessible. Also although the menu for the evening looked wonderful, in reality many choices including all the sweets were unavailiable and I am convinced we were given the leftovers from the wedding supper!! The staff were fine with us staying around until late the following day as our flight was not until 8pm (it actually left the tarmac after 10.30 but this was world cup final night and not a single member of the groundstaff could be found apparantly) We spent the day around the pool area which was gorgeous- a really lovely deep pool and a helpful attendant to bring cold drinks. The pool is next to a farm and it was very amusing to see the various animals. Be aware that the pool area is some distance from the lobby and involves a lot of steps. Alos the lunch menu at the pool is very restricted and the only alternative is the over-formal dining room. There was a second wedding on Sunday lunchtime and again this excluded us from eating lunch on the outside terrace. To conclude the hotel is stunning in aspect and offers great service and value. However if you are not with a wedding party you might feel a bit neglected.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent our 1st anniversary weekend in this hotel and found it to be a real experience! The drive up to the hotel gives you a sense of how hidden away from the bustle of Rome it is and how grand and old the castle and its grounds are. It is a little rough around the edges but mainly only in the sense that it has been allowed to keep its original look and is not overly-restored or decorated. We booked a standard room and found it to be large, clean with lovely features. We did not have dinner here but the breakfasts were lovely. The location is perfect in only being 15km from Rome but you do need to be prepared to spend part of the money you save on not paying Rome rates on transport. Make sure you ask the staff to book a normal taxi and not their 'limo' service which is about 50% more. The limo is merely a nice car eg Mercedes and not a limo as we refer to it here in the UK. We were charged 85 euro from the airport (Campino) to the hotel and this would be about 50/60 euro in a normal cab. If I was to make one recommendation to the hotel I would say supply cushions for the poolside loungers as they are not very comfy. The poolside experience is however enhanced by the variety of farm animals that walk past once a day! All in all well worth the money and a very unique experience. Be prepared for a wedding party til midnight most nights - we quite enjoyed their presence and watched the party from one of the terraces. An ideal choice if you are looking for somewhere to get wed!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible anniversary 'treat?'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite months before as an anniversary treat. Upon arrival they tried to put us down in the car park nowhere near the castle in an elaborately decorated outbuilding with a wall around so there were no views. It looked like an old gardeners store. Then was shown two more rooms in the castle which were below the castle floor level. Then was shown a better room with a view which we had to accept as the suites were all occupied; clearly due to the wedding party there. Even told lies though that an old lady was ill and could not leave her room which we had booked. which did not make sense at all as we were shown the empty room and told we could have it the next day. Upon check out we were charged above internet prices which we had booked for the standard room. The pool area was closed although it should have been open. They did not try to make amends in any way. However the restaurant waiters were excellent as was the food and all the 'open' areas in the castle. They rounded it all off by trying to charge us double the taxi fare to take us back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, beautiful, amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Shezza77
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Rome for a relaxing, romantic time and want top class service in incredible surroundings this is the hotel for you. This hotel is beautiful - a converted castle! It is on the outskirts of Rome - in the countyside - so you get the best of both worlds. The hotel will drop you at the nearby train station for you to take a leisurely train journey into Rome for day tripping...then pick you up from the station in the evening to transport you back to blissful castle dream like hotel for the evening. Wonderful pool, chapel (for weddings...I am dropping hints already!), amazing grounds. And the service- these staff CANNOT do enough for you. The best service I have ever had. Waited on hand and foot and the food in the restaurant is brilliant (and very reasonably priced). Away from the hustle and bustle (and HEAT) of Rome so the best of both worlds. Email the hotel before booking - they often have special package deals available. Oh yes ... and they will arrange for a limo to pick you up from the airport. What more can I say???

HotelInfo.Name: Castello della Castelluccia
HotelInfo.Address: Via Carlo Cavina, 00123 Rome, Italy
